conclusion: Analyze the displacement-time graph to determine when speed is 5 m/s.
Graph shows position x as a function of time t; slope gives velocity.
At t = 0, x = 10 m; at t = 2 s, x = 0 m; at t = 4 s, x = -10 m.
Slope of tangent line represents velocity; find where slope equals 5 m/s.
Velocity v is derivative of displacement with respect to time.
Slope changes continuously; need to find where slope is 5 m/s.
Slope is positive and decreasing between t = 0 and t = 2 s; negative and increasing between t = 2 s and t = 4 s.
Check if slope reaches 5 m/s in these intervals.
At t = 0, slope is steep but not 5 m/s; at t = 2 s, slope is zero; at t = 4 s, slope is steep but not 5 m/s.
Infer from trend that slope crosses 5 m/s at least once in each interval.
Conclude speed reaches 5 m/s at least twice within 0 to 4 seconds.
Number of moments when speed is 5 m/s is 2.
